Fazle Khan wrote:

> I am currently adding JUnit tests to a JUnitEE framework of an
> existing code base.  There has been a request that I use JunitDoclet
> to pre-generated stubbed testcases for the code base of 1700+
> classes.  My fear by doing so meaningful metrics (pass/fail counts)
> will not be able to be generated via JUnitEE.  I was hoping there was
> already a way of handling this in the frame work?
> 
> What I am considering is if a test class that extends TestCase also
> has the NotImplemented interface it won't be executed and won't be
> included in the testmetrics.

JUnit does not and will not do this. NUnit has the "ignored" attribute 
for tests, and the community does not agree on whether we like it.

As an alternative, use the JUnit-addons test runner, which ignores tests 
whose names end in _ignored.

Good luck.
